title: Riak Recap for September 12 - 13
description:
Posted on September 14, 2011

Evening, Morning, Afternoon to All -

For today’s Recap: blog posts, new code, and more.

Enjoy.

Mark

Riak Recap for September 12 – 13

  1. We released Riak 1.0.0pre3.
    → Downloads and updated release notes here
  2. Greg Stein and Reid Draper continue to do great stuff for the Python client.
    → Latest contributions here
  3. Kyle Kingsbury shared a sneak peak of the Riak metrics app he and John Muellerleile will be showing off at the talk they are giving on September 26th in San Francisco.
    → Picture and talk details here
  4. Mark Steele wrote a great post about how to stream chunk encoded HTTP responses that should be particularly interesting to any PHP devs on the list.
    → Read here
  5. Basho Dev. Rusty Klophaus wrote a blog post all about Secondary Indexing.
    → Read here
    → Hacker News Discussion
  6. We merged a sizable contribution to Riak Search from Greg Pascale and the Clipboard.com team that adds support for the ‘fl’ SOLR parameter. Thanks, Greg! (Did I mention Clipboard is hiring?)
    → Commit here
  7. We merged a small contribution to Riak from Morten Siebuhr. Thanks, Morten!
    → Commit here
  8. Another reminder about the Riak training happening Surge next week …
    → Details and registration here
